name: Dot Ninja
description:
The first thing that came to mind was a "connect the dots" like game where you control a ninja in the shape of a dot that uses a grappling hook to connect with dots on the walls to escape the room. Dot Ninja is the result of that idea.

How To Play
  1. Dot Ninja was designed with mobile in mind 
  2. Everything is controlled using the mouse. 
  3. Click on a target or the door to create connections
  4. Click on the player to reset all connections
  5. Click on a target that is not the last one to remove all connections after it
  6. Collect the keys and reach the door to win
    • This is your cursor
    • Click on targets on the wall or the door to connect to them
    • Connect to target
    • Remove all connections after this one
    • Trigger movement
  • Tools and Resources
    • Engine: Unity
    • Font: https://www.1001freefonts.com/spicy-rice.font
    • Sounds: Modified royalty free sounds
    • Music: From our previous "Temple of Life" game
  • Artwork and Level Design by Michael
  • Game Design and Programming by Nelson

Things we wanted to add but ran out of time:

  • Result screen after each level
  • Level selection
  • A level counter

We plan to add some time in the future and fix some minor bugs here and there ;)

Android Port
Has not been tested and is the same build as the pc and web, meaning it has not been updated and optimized for mobile usage but it works. 

Chrome Users 
This time around I received a "WebGL not supported" message when I had "Use hardware acceleration when available" settings enabled. Turning this off in the "advanced" setting for Chrome solved this problem.
